questions.question: What did the Georgia Legislature decide to do to the Georgia state flag in 1956?

choices.answer: Changed its shape from square to rectangular
Change the colors to gold and blue
Add a picture of a boll of cotton
Added "southern cross"--well-known Confederate battle flag

questions.question: What was the ruling of the US Supreme Court in Brown v Board of Education?

choices.answer: Blacks could attend white schools IF space was available
Schools would continue to be segregated
The "separate but equal" policy was unconstitutional
Black schools would receive more money for books & teachers

questions.question: The purpose of the Sibley Commission was to

choices.answer: recommend for desegregation in public transportation
study the problem of school integration
set up meetings to bring blacks & whites together
develop a plan for securing jobs for blacks
making proposals to the legislature to address racial issues
a quota system to ensure the hiring of black workers
integrating GA's public transportation system
integrating schools on a limited basis

questions.question: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. favored bringing about social change by

choices.answer: job growth
running for office
nonviolent resistance
force

questions.question: Which approach did MLK Jr. NOT use to gain equality and civil rights for all citizens?

choices.answer: Legal action against violators of civil rights based on race
Economic boycott on businesses that treat citizens unfairly
nonviolent actions -- marches, protests, & demonstrations
Aggressive pursuit of civil rights - violent protests, riots

questions.question: Who was chairman of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC)?

choices.answer: John Sibley
Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
John Lewis
Booker T. Washington

questions.question: The goal of the Albany Movement in GA was to

choices.answer: force hiring of black bus drivers for Albany transit system
end segregation of public schools in Albany
put a "first-come, first-served" policy on Albany's schools
integrate the entire city of Albany

questions.question: Why was the Civil Rights Act of 1964 passed?

choices.answer: To guarantee the employment of women in  government
To honor the anniversary of the March on Washington
To bring about the end of segregation in society
To allow African Americans to move to Canada

questions.question: Which statement BEST describes the Civil Rights Movement?

choices.answer: Caused white Americans to support desegregating schools
Created social and economic inequality for white Americans
Nonviolent movement seeking to gain equal rights for blacks
Was unorganized and without African-American leadership

questions.question: The 1963 March on Washington was planned to bring attention to which topics

choices.answer: Fair Employment
Voting Rights
Integrated Education
All of these

questions.question: What did Lester Maddox accomplish as governor?

choices.answer: Changed the state flag to remove the Confederate symbols
Started the lottery and the HOPE scholarship
Decreased funding to public schools and the arts
Appointed more blacks to state gov't than any other governor

questions.question: MLK Jr's "I Have A Dream" speech is associated with the

choices.answer: "Letter from the Birmingham Jail"
Sibley Commission Report
Montgomery Bus Boycott
March on Washington 1963

questions.question: What is the relationship between Brown v Board of Ed and Plessy v Ferguson?

choices.answer: They both dealt with race relations
Brown overturned Plessy ending "separate but equal"
Plessy overturned Brown keeping "separate but equal"
Brown supported Plessy decision keeping separate but equal

questions.question: Which person and his description are matched correctly?

choices.answer: John Lewis - GA Governor
Lester Maddox - CEO of Coca Cola
Martin Luther King Jr - Civil Rights Leader
John Sibley - Civil Rights Leader
